title: Explosion at South Florida Shopping Plaza Injures 20
summary: Authorities say a gas explosion leveled a pizza shop. PLANTATION, Fla.-Twenty people were injured after a vacant pizza restaurant exploded in a South Florida shopping plaza Saturday, according to police.

title: Democrats in Queens District Attorney Race Headed for Legal Showdown
summary: State judge will hear arguments over invalidated ballots, while officials prepare for manual recount. The Democratic primary for Queens district attorney has turned into a nail-biter that won't be decided until a state judge hears arguments over invalidated ballots and election officials manually recount all the votes in the race.

title: Kawhi Leonard and Paul George Pick Their Los Angeles Team: The Clippers
summary: The biggest move yet of NBA free agency reflects league's new reality. The most talented players want to work for the most competent teams. Kawhi Leonard had the NBA in the palm of his enormous hands this summer. For the first time in his career, he was an unrestricted free agent with the power to choose where he worked, and he was going to tilt the league's competitive balance no matter which team he chose.

title: Erdogan Dismisses Governor of Turkey's Central Bank
summary: The Turkish president has pledged to return to low-interest rate policy. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has dismissed the governor of Turkey's central bank, sparking fresh investor concerns over the independence of an institution that has strained to combat runaway inflation.

title: Alaska Faces Budget Fight Over State University Cuts
summary: College system is at risk of losing 41% of its state funding. A chaotic budget fight in Alaska sparked by a new governor's efforts to increase the annual oil royalty payments sent to residents may result in steep cuts-including layoffs and unpaid leave-at the state university system.

title: Catholics Grapple With Transgender Issues
summary: Church institutions try to heed pope's call to respect transgender people while rejecting the idea of gender as fluid. At St. Brigid's National School, a Catholic primary school near Dublin, boys will soon be allowed to wear the green tartan pinafore that was until now the girls' uniform. Girls will be allowed to wear trousers to class. The school is also making its bathrooms gender-neutral.

title: 'I Kind of Redeemed Myself'-College Programs Aim to Shift the Odds for Prison Inmates

title: Indians Hunt Through the Night for Water as a Megacity Runs Dry
summary: Population growth, poor planning and increasingly erratic monsoon rains leave public water supply more than one-third short of what is needed. The southern city of Chennai-India's fifth largest with a population of around 10 million-has been meeting only two-thirds of its water needs for weeks, the product of years of drought and decades of failure to manage the region's water resources.

title: Archbishop Fulton Sheen to Be Beatified
summary: Miracle opens the way for the pioneering televangelist to be beatified or declared 'blessed'. ROME-The late American Archbishop Fulton J. title: Cuccinelli Takes Reins of Immigration Agency With Focus on Migrant Vetting
summary: Acting head of U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services brings a devotion to Trump's agenda and a reputation for controversy. WASHINGTON-The new head of the U.S. legal immigration system is a devout defender of the Trump administration's bid to remake U.S. immigration policy through the regulatory process, with a blunt message about the role of the agency he now leads.

title: Everyone Wants to be the Next 'Game of Thrones'
summary: Hollywood and book publishers are racing to find an epic fantasy to fill the void left by the HBO hit's end. Who will survive the Game of Clones?

title: Surging Air Traffic Prompts Rethink of Airport Gate Rights
summary: New system allocating takeoff and landing slots gives airports more say over industry's priciest real estate. Rapid growth in global air travel is prompting airlines and airport operators to shake up a decades-old system for allocating takeoff and landing slots at some of the world's busiest airfields.

title: Strongest Quake in Years Rocks Southern California
summary: The magnitude 7.1 temblor hit near Ridgecrest, where a 6.4 quake stuck Thursday. LOS ANGELES-A magnitude 7.1 earthquake jolted much of California, cracking buildings, starting fires, breaking roads and causing several injuries, authorities and residents said.

title: Greece's Prospects Remain Bleak, Whoever Governs
summary: Center-right party is poised to win Sunday's general elections, but even its pro-business leader will have hard time revitalizing economy. ATHENS-Greeks are expected to elect a pro-business government Sunday, but the prospects for the country's crisis-scarred economy remain grim.

title: Amtrak Has Lost Money for Decades. A Former Airline CEO Thinks He Can Fix It.
summary: Onetime Delta CEO Richard Anderson has nearly eliminated the railroad's operating losses, but some train fanatics are fuming about the changes. The signs are aimed at the thousands of train passengers who rumble each day through North Philadelphia-two banners 14 feet high by 26 feet wide, mounted outside an old package-sorting facility built in the heyday of the Pennsylvania Railroad.

title: Instagram Turns Obscure U.S. Sights Into Social-Media Destinations
summary: Attendance grows 50-fold at scenic Horseshoe Bend, bringing change and tragedy. PAGE, Ariz.-On a recent June afternoon, 18-year-old Aaron Diggdon positioned himself at the edge of a 1,000-foot drop-off at a natural attraction here called Horseshoe Bend-so his father could take some photos for Instagram.

title: David Crosby Is Making Songs as He Faces the End
summary: Burdened by an array of health problems, the legendary singer-songwriter says he is 'trying to get the music out of my head'. Aging rock legends don't generally record a lot of new music. The incentives are low in today's age of streaming, when money is made on the road as longtime fans come out to hear elderly icons play their hits. So why is David Crosby-77 years old and a two-time Rock and Roll Hall of Fame entrant, as a member of both the Byrds and Crosby, Stills & Nash-releasing albums at a feverish clip, dropping four in the past five years?

title: How Much Do Coaches Matter?
summary: To Andre Iguodala, they are just one part of the equation, but acolytes of a 'trillon-dollar' mentor swear by his importance. In 1979, Bill Campbell quit his job as head coach of Columbia University's chronically dreadful football team. He moved to California to work for Apple and eventually became chief executive of Intuit.

title: Administration Presses Bid on Census Question
summary: Trump says he is considering executive order, other options to add citizenship question; government suffers court setback. WASHINGTON-President Trump indicated he might seek an executive order to place a citizenship question on the census, one of several options the administration is considering in the wake of a Supreme Court decision that stymied its push to do so.
